result.execSummary:
The defendant James W Walters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

No contact with Amaryllis B., except with consent of the Probation Officer.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
No illegal drugs.
No contact with the victims.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant James W Walters in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.    Penalty enhancer struck by Court upon motion of the State.   Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in.

Court orders the following:
Ct.  1:
- Total sentence: 2 years - (Initial Confinement: 1 year - credit for 49 days - consecutive to 13CF156,  Extended Supervision: 1 year)  
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs totaling $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- DNA Surcharge totaling $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  No contact with Amaryllis B. except with consent of Probation Officer. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with the victims. No illegal drugs.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.
